The `quickmodel` function builds multiple categorical and quantitative machine learning models with just one function call. Of the models created in `quickmodel`, the `bestmodel` function chooses the model that has the best perfomance criteria. 

```{r setup}
library(quickmodelR)

# Load in data to use for creating models
data(PIMA)

# Run quickmodel function to create all default models 
result <- quickmodel(Diabetes ~ ., data = PIMA)

# Run bestmodel function to retrieve the best model of the models created, based on the evaluation metric
bestmodel <- bestmodel(result)
```
